name: Bougainvillea
origin: South America, widely cultivated in the Philippines
interestingFact: Known for vibrant walls and hedges; bracts, not petals, provide the vivid color.

name: Jasmine(Sampaguita)
origin: Native to Southeast Asia, Philippines’ national flower
interestingFact: Used in garlands, perfumes, and religious offerings; symbolizes purity and simplicity.

name: Plumeria (Kalachuchi)
origin: Central America; tropical plant widely grown in the Philippines
interestingFact: Commonly used in leis and decorations; blooms in warm, sunny weather.

name: Hibiscus (Gumamela)
interestingFact: Symbol of beauty and courage; leaves and flowers used in herbal teas.

name: Sunflower
origin: North America, widely cultivated in the Philippines
interestingFact: Follows the sun’s movement (heliotropism); seeds are edible.

name: Orchids
origin: Worldwide; many native to the Philippines
interestingFact: Waling-waling (Vanda sanderiana) is called 'Queen of Philippine flowers.'

name: Red Scarlet Lily
interestingFact: Represents passion and pride; often used in floral arrangements.

name: Tulip
interestingFact: Symbol of spring and renewal; blooms in cool seasons.

name: Peony
interestingFact: Symbolizes romance, prosperity, and honor; highly fragrant.

name: Rose
interestingFact: Symbol of love and beauty; petals used in perfumes and teas.

name: Cherry Blossom (Sakura)
interestingFact: Short-lived blooms symbolize the fleeting nature of life.

name: Lavender
interestingFact: Used in perfumes, essential oils, and aromatherapy.

name: Hydrangea
interestingFact: Flower color depends on soil pH (acidic soil = blue, alkaline = pink).

name: Baby’s Breath (Gypsophila)
interestingFact: Popular as a filler in bouquets; symbolizes everlasting love.

name: Wisteria
interestingFact: Often grows on pergolas or arches; symbolizes longevity and beauty.

name: Ixora (Santan)
origin: Southern Asia; common in the Philippines
interestingFact: Popular for hedges; symbolizes devotion and passion.

name: Chrysanthemum
interestingFact: Symbolizes happiness and longevity in Asian cultures; blooms in cool seasons.

name: Daisy
interestingFact: Symbol of innocence and purity; easy to grow and commonly found in gardens.
